I love an intelligent rant.

The space suits he was talking about are also known as skin tight space suits... They do not have air inside, but are like a super strong spandex that is porous.
It uses mechanical pressure instead of air pressure to support your skin.
The funny thing is that they end up looking like something off the cover of an old pulp SF magazine! They have been tested in vacuum chambers and they work, and are dirt cheap compared to conventional suites.
They are porous to allow you to sweat right through the suit, so eliminating a lot of the need for wasting a lot of weight on the cooling system. The only part with pressure is the helmet.
Another advantage is that it has full mobility without having to use the complicated constant volume joints necessary on normal suites to allow you to move. It a break or cut occurs in the suit, instead of dying, you just get a bad version of a 'hicky' :-) For outside use, you would slip on a 'armored' shell to protect you from the sun, and micro particles etc.
Completely agree with your point about tribalism, we need to move away from this weird notion that everything one side does is evil and the other is good.
